name: File Stream Bot
description: A Telethon Telegram bot to access Telegram Files via the web.

BIN_CHANNEL.description: Channel ID of your Bin Channel

ALLOWED_USERS.description: A list of user IDs separated by comma (,). If this is set, only the users in this list will be able to use the bot.

CHUNK_SIZE.description: Size of the chunk to request from Telegram server when streaming a file

CONNECTION_LIMIT.description: (default 20) - The maximum number of connections to a single Telegram datacenter

FQDN.description: Heroku App URL or Custom Domain. Update it after deploying

HAS_SSL.description: (can be either True or False) If you want the generated links in https format

KEEP_ALIVE.description: (can be either True or False) If you want to make Heroku App ping itself every. Set to True if your using Eco Dyno

NO_PORT.description: (can be either True or False) If you don't want your port to be displayed. Leave it as it is

NO_UPDATE.description: if set to true bot won't respond to any messages

PING_INTERVAL.description: The time in seconds you want the servers to be pinged each time to avoid sleeping (Only for Heroku/Render). Defaults to 1200 or 10 minutes

REQUEST_LIMIT.description: (default 5) - The maximum number of requests a single IP can have active at a time

SLEEP_THRESHOLD.description: Set a sleep threshold for flood wait exceptions happening globally in this telegram bot instance, below which any request that raises a flood wait will be automatically invoked again after sleeping for the required amount of time. Flood wait exceptions requiring higher waiting times will be raised. Defaults to 60 seconds.

TRUST_HEADERS.description: (defaults to true) - Whether or not to trust X-Forwarded-For headers when logging requests
